trans-unit.source: How to create and use groups to manage developer accounts in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to create and use groups to manage developer accounts in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage developer accounts using groups in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage developer accounts using groups in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: In API Management, groups are used to manage the visibility of products to developers.
trans-unit.target: In API Management, groups are used to manage the visibility of products to developers.

trans-unit.source: Products are first made visible to groups, and then developers in those groups can view and subscribe to the products that are associated with the groups.
trans-unit.target: Products are first made visible to groups, and then developers in those groups can view and subscribe to the products that are associated with the groups.

trans-unit.source: API Management has the following immutable system groups.
trans-unit.target: API Management has the following immutable system groups.

trans-unit.source: Administrators - Azure subscription administrators are members of this group.
trans-unit.target: Administrators - Azure subscription administrators are members of this group.

trans-unit.source: Administrators manage API Management service instances, creating the APIs, operations, and products that are used by developers.
trans-unit.target: Administrators manage API Management service instances, creating the APIs, operations, and products that are used by developers.

trans-unit.source: Developers - Authenticated developer portal users fall into this group.
trans-unit.target: Developers - Authenticated developer portal users fall into this group.

trans-unit.source: Developers are the customers that build applications using your APIs.
trans-unit.target: Developers are the customers that build applications using your APIs.

trans-unit.source: Developers are granted access to the developer portal and build applications that call the operations of an API.
trans-unit.target: Developers are granted access to the developer portal and build applications that call the operations of an API.

trans-unit.source: Guests - Unauthenticated developer portal users, such as prospective customers visiting the developer portal of an API Management instance fall into this group.
trans-unit.target: Guests - Unauthenticated developer portal users, such as prospective customers visiting the developer portal of an API Management instance fall into this group.

trans-unit.source: They can be granted certain read-only access, such as the ability to view APIs but not call them.
trans-unit.target: They can be granted certain read-only access, such as the ability to view APIs but not call them.

trans-unit.source: In addition to these system groups, administrators can create custom groups or <linkText>leverage external groups in associated Azure Active Directory tenants</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In addition to these system groups, administrators can create custom groups or <linkText>leverage external groups in associated Azure Active Directory tenants</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Custom and external groups can be used alongside system groups in giving developers visibility and access to API products.
trans-unit.target: Custom and external groups can be used alongside system groups in giving developers visibility and access to API products.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could create one custom group for developers affiliated with a specific partner organization and allow them access to the APIs from a product containing relevant APIs only.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could create one custom group for developers affiliated with a specific partner organization and allow them access to the APIs from a product containing relevant APIs only.

trans-unit.source: A user can be a member of more than one group.
trans-unit.target: A user can be a member of more than one group.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows how administrators of an API Management instance can add new groups and associate them with products and developers.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows how administrators of an API Management instance can add new groups and associate them with products and developers.

trans-unit.source: To create a new group, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To create a new group, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click Groups from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Add Group.
trans-unit.target: Click Groups from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Add Group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add new group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add new group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the group and an optional description, and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the group and an optional description, and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add new group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add new group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The new group is displayed in the groups tab.
trans-unit.target: The new group is displayed in the groups tab.

trans-unit.source: To edit the Name or Description of the group, click the name of the group in the list.
trans-unit.target: To edit the Name or Description of the group, click the name of the group in the list.

trans-unit.source: To delete the group, click Delete.
trans-unit.target: To delete the group, click Delete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Group added</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Group added</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that the group is created, it can be associated with products and developers.
trans-unit.target: Now that the group is created, it can be associated with products and developers.

trans-unit.source: To associate a group with a product, click Products from the API Management menu on the left, and then click the name of the desired product.
trans-unit.target: To associate a group with a product, click Products from the API Management menu on the left, and then click the name of the desired product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set visibility</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set visibility</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the Visibility tab to add and remove groups, and to view the current groups for the product.
trans-unit.target: Select the Visibility tab to add and remove groups, and to view the current groups for the product.

trans-unit.source: To add or remove groups, check or uncheck the checkboxes for the desired groups and click Save.
trans-unit.target: To add or remove groups, check or uncheck the checkboxes for the desired groups and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set visibility</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set visibility</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add Azure Active Directory groups, see <linkText>How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To add Azure Active Directory groups, see <linkText>How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To configure groups from the Visibility tab for a product, click Manage Groups.
trans-unit.target: To configure groups from the Visibility tab for a product, click Manage Groups.

trans-unit.source: Once a product is associated with a group, developers in that group can view and subscribe to the product.
trans-unit.target: Once a product is associated with a group, developers in that group can view and subscribe to the product.

trans-unit.source: To associate groups with developers, click Users from the API Management menu on the left, and then check the box beside the developers you wish to associate with a group.
trans-unit.target: To associate groups with developers, click Users from the API Management menu on the left, and then check the box beside the developers you wish to associate with a group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add developer to group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add developer to group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the desired developers are checked, click the desired group in the Add to Group drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired developers are checked, click the desired group in the Add to Group drop-down.

trans-unit.source: Developers can be removed from groups by using the Remove from Group drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Developers can be removed from groups by using the Remove from Group drop-down.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developers</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developers</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the association is added between the developer and the group, you can view it in the Users tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the association is added between the developer and the group, you can view it in the Users tab.

trans-unit.source: Once a developer is added to a group, they can view and subscribe to the products associated with that group.
trans-unit.target: Once a developer is added to a group, they can view and subscribe to the products associated with that group.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How create and publish a product in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>,
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How create and publish a product in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>,
